Articles.Content: Oh my... serious surely is far out. Good thing we have KSP interstellar.

Let me commend you on your work, this is excellent stuff! I'm already pushing the memory ceiling or I'd definitely pursue this. Amazing, this is the first thing I'll look if KSP ever overcomes its memory issues.
Can someone upload a view from the map view, wanna see the new planets and stuff(and maybe see something about their orbits,heard they're odd,AKA, hard to reach)

Can someone upload a view from the map view, wanna see the new planets and stuff(and maybe see something about their orbits,heard they're odd,AKA, hard to reach)

Look back, like 4 posts.
So, I got to Serious with liquid fuel. Not that hard. Don't see why people are saying "Interstellar Mod to the Rescue!"
Since I don't really like serious in this mod, I just hyper edited it to be super far away, and I put Joker in a Pluto-equivalent orbit around Kerbol. Now its time to do a New Horizons mission.
Does anyone know the science values?

Does anyone know the science values?

It dosen't have science, as far as I know.
Thank you for submitting officially and adding source code! I can't wait to check out the new star!

So, I got to Serious with liquid fuel. Not that hard. Don't see why people are saying "Interstellar Mod to the Rescue!"

Because I don't want to send my kerbals on a trip that's 8 years each way. Therefore KSPI. Serious shouldn't require a lot of extra fuel relative to Sentar, but it sure is a long trip.

Its true, Serious is rather easy (dv) to get to. Surprising isn't it? Ablate is much harder.

Speaking of Ablate. I am surprised no one has climbed The Spike.

http://www.reddit.com/r/KerbalSpaceProgram/comments/1qo2u3/planetfactory_space_elevator_challenge/

Edited December 5, 2013 by Kragrathea

Krag you should get in contact with this man

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/37219-Planet-Ideas

Also Amazing work, I'm glad someone found out how to add planets.
Do Ringle's rings have hitboxes, aka can you touch them?

It dosen't have science, as far as I know.

I sent a copy of my Jool probe payload to Sentar when the mod first came out. I don't recall the exact figures offhand, but I'm fairly sure I got science. Unless something's changed.

I'd like to see this planet named Cite in this mod, Go here: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/42625-Possible-Planet-Additions-%28Revised%29

Like this:

\

And its moon would be this:

Hope to see this in the mod! I give credit to Samio for the pictures. Also maybe it would be a new planet orbiting serious!

Edited December 5, 2013 by uxuser

It would be damn awesome to create a binary system with Kerbol and Serious. From my understanding though that would mean the planets would have to be much further out. Don't planets in binary systems orbit the barycenter and not the individual stars?
I'd really like to see Ablate orbiting Serious rather than Kerbol. How possible is that?

It would be damn awesome to create a binary system with Kerbol and Serious. From my understanding though that would mean the planets would have to be much further out. Don't planets in binary systems orbit the barycenter and not the individual stars?

The planets can orbit the barycentre of both stars, or could orbit just one of the stars. I don't believe any binary systems have been found where both are the case - depends on the distance between the stars I think.

I sent a copy of my Jool probe payload to Sentar when the mod first came out. I don't recall the exact figures offhand, but I'm fairly sure I got science. Unless something's changed.

Hmph. In the first version, atleast, it didn't have science. Only 0.0 science "something tells me these are not the results you are looking for"
Well I've messed around a bit and now KSP crashes immediately at startup. I must be doing something right!
I reverse engineered the Planet Factory code. yey

From my understanding of the science resource CFG file, all the varying experiments (Air sample, seismic reading, crew report, etc), all have exactly the same initial value for all places (except kerbin which is lower). I have done a mission to Erin and received as much science as I did when I took the same lander to laythe. So as far as I'm aware, there is as much actual science in the new planets, but the science messages are the same as the planet that Krag based his planets on( I am not sure completely about this one... I only read half of the messages...)

If it gives 0 science and says that this is not what your looking for... I have only experienced this in sandbox mode.
Has anyone figured out how to put a couple of Sentar's moons in orbit of Serious, along with Ablate?

You can move any of the bodies that you have in that load of the game with Hyperedit. However if you want the changes to be slightly more permanent, you can edit the CFG files of some of the moons. Some will say in comments inside the file weather the planet is configurable on that release or not. The moons of sentar that are configurable inside the cfg files include Skelton, Thud, and Erin. Pock(Not actually a moon of Sentar....) and Ringle are not configurable. I have not looked for more than 30 seconds at the source code so I am not certain why they are not configurable, but I am sure that Krag and anyone who has looked and understood the source code will be able to explain it.

So uh can anyone explain why the sun is coming from the wrong direction?

EDIT:

Orbiting inside Flollop's map view object?

This is the most boring planet.

EDIT2:

Oh the scaling issue is because I used Tylo as a template instead of Minmus.

Fixed the terrain too.

Edited December 6, 2013 by Nutt007
